meanings.definition: Cause (a large amount of damage or harm)
meanings.sent1: The storm wreaks havoc on the small town, destroying homes and trees.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake wreaks devastation on the city, leaving buildings in ruins.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy wreaks chaos in the living room, scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The virus wreaks havoc on the body, attacking cells and causing illness.
meanings.sent5: The firework display wreaks a spectacular show in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.

meanings.sent1: The superhero wreaks justice on the villain, ensuring peace in the city.
meanings.sent2: The dictator wreaks punishment on those who oppose his rule, instilling fear in the population.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student wreaks revenge on his prankster friend, surprising him with a practical joke.
meanings.sent4: The ghostly figure wreaks vengeance on those who wronged him in life, haunting them in their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The warrior wreaks retribution on the enemy, seeking justice for his fallen comrades.

meanings.definition: Bring about (a particular result or effect)
meanings.sent1: The new policy wreaks changes in the company, improving efficiency and productivity.
meanings.sent2: The scientific discovery wreaks advancements in the field, revolutionizing technology.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion wreaks transformations on the potion drinker, turning him into a frog.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech wreaks inspiration in the audience, motivating them to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected twist in the story wreaks surprises on the readers, keeping them engaged till the end.
